New Records: Jason Holder posted career-best T20 figures of 4 for 7
Key Match Events: Jason Holder produced a career-best T20 performance with the ball to help West Indies ease to a nine-wicket victory over England
Sheldon Cottrell and Holder removed Jason Roy, Tom Banton and Moeen Ali inside two overs
James Vince smashed Cottrell for 14 runs in five balls before finding Darren Bravo at short cover
Sam Billings was stumped by Shai Hope (bowled Akeal Hosein)
Chris Jordan and Adil Rashid added 36 runs off 29 balls to move England safely past their lowest T20I total
Holder picked off Saqib Mahmood with a slower ball and bowled Rashid to finish with figures of 4 for 7
Brandon King and Nicholas Pooran steered West Indies to victory with 17 balls to spare
Pre-Game Insights: Kieron Pollard’s side headed into the series in poor form, winning just nine of their 26 T20Is since the start of 2021
England, T20 World Cup semi-finalists, are the No.1 ranked side in the format
Post-Match Reflections: The win was a confidence-boosting victory for West Indies
